column4: I'm trying to bring a cli system to just enough to have openbox running using xdm login... I installed xdm, xinit, and startx. When I try to use startx I'm getting the error exec: 5: /usr/bin/X11/X: not found - what else do I need to install?
xserver-xorg, and xfonts-75dpi to get X to start, at least
thanks
heh, I have hacked a lot with minimal debian systems
Now I'm getting an error about xrdb command not found - package doesn't exist
that command should not be neccesary to get X itself running, only xserver-xorg and xfonts-75dpi are what I usually need
alrighty - what about getting xdm to launch when I login?
display managers usually launch on boot from init.d, you would manually startx if you want a terminal logon
I want to login with xdm
am I misunderstanding? is gdm not meant for logins?
that's normally done, as it creates an initscript
ya lost me
*dm is for logging on graphically, startx is for testing/starting from a terminal
so - I installed xdm... I'll reboot and see if I can login?
you should only need to use /etc/init.d/*dm, or xdm is some strange package
yep, /etc/init.d/xdm start, as always
it's still freaking out about that command not being found
seems strange, let's walk through dependencies :)
just xrdb - idk if it matters really, but I don't like errors
x11-xserver-utils contains the package, usually some application should have that as dependency if it's needed
hurray :D - thanks much
I'm gonna reboot and see if it comes up right away
